titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Holdings at the Litchfield Historical Society
titlestmt.author: Collection Description/Finding Aid prepared by Leith Johnson.

publicationstmt.p: © Copyright 2010 Litchfield Historical Society. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was encoding in EAD by Archon 2.22 from an SQL database source on May 19th, 2010.

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: The papers of Norman Hall (1805-1852) and a son, William J. Hall (1839-1912), residents of Milton, a part of Litchfield, consisting of deeds and an estate inventory. The papers of William also contain a certificate of exemption from service during the Civil War and related documents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers of Norman Hall (1805-1852) and a son, William J. Hall (1839-1912), residents of Milton, a part of Litchfield, consisting of deeds and an estate inventory. The papers of William also contain a certificate of exemption from service during the Civil War and related documents.
To see a detailed inventory of the papers, click "Show Digital Content Links" at left and then "Hall Family Collection inventory."

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p: The papers are arranged in three folders.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Hall Family Collection (1961-38-0), Litchfield Historical Society, Helga J. Ingraham Memorial Library, P.O. Box 385, 7 South Street, Litchfield, Connecticut, 06759

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Litchfield Historical Society from Everett Perkins on 07/31/1961.

odd.head: Other Information
odd.p: This collection was processed with support from the National Historical Publications and Records Commission (NHPRC).
